intro: Dorstenia lactifera, commonly known as the milky star, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers that are often covered in a sticky, milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, with hairy stems and palmate leaves that are divided into several lobes. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The sap of Dorstenia lactifera has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties in some indigenous communities.
